ca.gedge.opgraph.io.xml
Interface XMLSerializer

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultExtendableXMLSerializer, DefaultFieldXMLSerializer, DefaultGraphXMLSerializer, DefaultLinkXMLSerializer, DefaultNodeXMLSerializer, MacroNodeXMLSerializer, PublishedFieldXMLSerializer
public interface XMLSerializer

An extension for classes that require custom XML serialization.

Method Summary
 boolean handles(Class<?> cls)
          Gets whether or not this serializer writes the given class.
 boolean handles(QName name)
          Gets whether or not this serializer can read a given qualified name.
 Object read(XMLSerializerFactory serializerFactory, OpGraph graph, Object parent, Document doc, Element elem)
          Reads an object from an XML event stream.
 void write(XMLSerializerFactory serializerFactory, Document doc, Element parentElem, Object obj)
          Writes an object to a parent element.
 

Method Detail

write

void write(XMLSerializerFactory serializerFactory,
           Document doc,
           Element parentElem,
           Object obj)
           throws IOException
Writes an object to a parent element.

Parameters:
serializerFactory - a factory to fetch XML serializers
doc - the DOM document
parentElem - the parent DOM element
obj - the object to write
Throws:
IOException - if the given object cannot be written by this handler

read

Object read(XMLSerializerFactory serializerFactory,
            OpGraph graph,
            Object parent,
            Document doc,
            Element elem)
            throws IOException
Reads an object from an XML event stream.

Parameters:
serializerFactory - a factory to fetch XML serializers
graph - the graph currently being read
parent - the parent object from which reading occured
doc - the DOM document
elem - the parent DOM element
Returns:
the object described in the given element
Throws:
IOException - if the given stream does not contain XML data which this handler understands

handles

boolean handles(Class<?> cls)
Gets whether or not this serializer writes the given class.

Parameters:
cls - the class to check
Returns:
true if this serializer can write the given class, false otherwise

handles

boolean handles(QName name)
Gets whether or not this serializer can read a given qualified name.

Parameters:
name - the qualified name to check
Returns:
true if this serializer can read the given qualified name, false otherwise
